issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Found this per part of the automated block device map tests:
This test runs an image registered with multiple ebs devices and an ephemeral device mapped, part way through the test the instance is stopped and re-started. The instance fails to 'start'. Manually trying to 'start' the instance after the automated test fails as well. Looks like this doesn't make it to the NC,  and looks like the CC is getting a terminate but not seeing anything related to restarting the instance. Snippet (below) from the CLC shows a few messages that are consistent with the failure. I was able to reproduce this on a TGT system, as well as a netapp cluster mode system. 
Note: Images registered with only a single ebs block device are re-starting in this test correctly.
Thanks,
-M
Block device map used when registering the image (failing bdm):
{code}
[2013-05-14 11:19:16,299] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
                                              BLOCK DEVICE MAP                                             
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
DEVICE          |   VOLUME_ID   |    SNAP_ID    | D.O.T.| SIZE | EPHEMERAL  | NO DEV| ATTACH TM  | STATUS
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
    /dev/vdc    |      None     | snap-381E3DD6 |  True |  1   |    None    | False |    None    |  None 
    /dev/vdb    |      None     |      None     | False | None | ephemeral0 | False |    None    |  None 
    /dev/vdd    |      None     |      None     |  True |  2   |    None    | False |    None    |  None 
    /dev/sda    |      None     | snap-F4F03A33 |  True |  3   |    None    | False |    None    |  None 
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
{code}


{working bdm, single ebs volume in bdm...)
{code}

DEVICE          |   VOLUME_ID   |    SNAP_ID    | D.O.T.| SIZE | EPHEMERAL  | NO DEV| ATTACH TM  | STATUS
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
    /dev/sda    |      None     | snap-F4F03A33 |  True |  3   |    None    | False |    None    |  None 
----------------|---------------|---------------|-------|------|------------|-------|------------|--------
{code}

{code}
fields.summary: Failure to 'start' stopped EBS backed instances w/ multiple ebs devices mapped
fields.environment:
System#!:GIT_HASH	88f2da3cc46b3055a2462ea26df9e70dc391b010

192.168.51.71	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[CLC WS]
192.168.51.72	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[SC00 CC00]
192.168.51.73	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[NC00]

MEMO
CLOUD_OPTS=--debug

SET_VNET_NETMASK=255.255.240.0


SAN_PROVIDER=NO-SAN


System #2:
GIT_HASH	a3c81032c2f97a835c7c71c2967d791ba55f755d
10.111.1.13	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS UI]
10.111.1.34	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.1.41	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.1.58	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]

USE_EPEL_REPO=YES

LOCAL_EUCA2OOLS_REPO=http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/builds/euca2ools/commit/6907915e955a170b689e40d1e177155a7abe800b-2013-01-16-000-import-01/rhel/6/x86_64/

EXTRA_PKG=postgresql91-server PyGreSQL java-1.7.0-openjdk-devel

EBS_STORAGE_MANAGER=SANManager
SAN_PROVIDER=NetappProvider
NETAPP_MODE=Cluster
USE_MULTIPATHING=YES

comments.body:
[~swathi] 
Just fyi, I tried w/ and w/o ephemeral and so far it looks like it may only fail to start when an ephemeral disk is present?
thanks,-M
Caused by a failing database transaction due to StaleObjectStateException. [~kedwards] is testing a fix for a related issue EUCA-6016

[~mclark] A good way to verify the fix would be to load up the instance request with device mappings and let it run. I saw the database exceptions when I had 2 or more device mappings. In my case it didn't matter if ephemeral disk was in the list of mappings.
Approved as release pending per management team review.  Please reopen if there is an issue
